title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify cross 3 as the cross in which the female parent was most likely heterozygous.
The response identifies cross 3 as the cross in which the female parent was most likely heterozygous.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not determine that the hypothesis is not supported because an unaffected female could be heterozygous and pass on the recessive allele.
The response determines that the hypothesis is not supported because an unaffected female could be heterozygous and pass on the recessive allele.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain that traits encoded by mitochondrial genes are inherited from the female parent only, resulting in offspring that all have the same genotype as their mother.
The response explains that traits encoded by mitochondrial genes are inherited from the female parent only, resulting in offspring that all have the same genotype as their mother.
